page.title: 07EXETER ST.DAVID'S STATION
page.content: The first{station}at St.David's was opened in 1844; the present buildings were completed in 1914. During the first half of 1985 multi-aspect signalling has been introduced, controlled from a{new power box.}This box controls the signalling on the main line from near Taunton to Totnes. It{replaces 30 mechanical boxes,}cost Â£850,000 and is operated by 4 signalmen. At the same time the track layout at St.David's has been simplified, and made more versatile; many conflicting movements have been eliminated. Almost{400 people}work at the station including 102 guards and 200 drivers. The station has 251 passenger and parcel arrivals and departures on a weekday. A new Travel Centre has just opened at a cost of Â£280,000.
